author: vors
body:
<!--

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->
## Steps to reproduce

This is the second part of issue with #2342

There is a legitimate PS code that results in the corrupted JSON file

```
PS C:\Users\sevoroby> Set-ExecutionPolicy -Scope LocalMachine -ExecutionPolicy Undefined -Force
PS C:\Users\sevoroby> Get-ExecutionPolicy -List

        Scope ExecutionPolicy
        ----- ---------------
MachinePolicy       Undefined
   UserPolicy       Undefined
      Process    RemoteSigned
  CurrentUser    RemoteSigned
Get-ExecutionPolicy : Error reading JToken from JsonReader. Path '', line 0, position 0.
At line:1 char:1
+ Get-ExecutionPolicy -List
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [Get-ExecutionPolicy], JsonReaderException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReaderException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.GetExecutionPolicyComm
   and
```
## Expected behavior

No error.
## Actual behavior

Error from NewtonSoft.JSON
It also prevents PS from starting, due to #2342
## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

``` powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha
CLRVersion
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.10
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
PSEdition                      Core
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
```

comments.author: mirichmo
comments.body:
The simplest repro is to empty the config file:

``` powershell
Set-Content <path to config file> -Value "{}"
```

and then restart PowerShell.

title: Setting ExecutionPolicy LocalMachine Undefined results in corrupted json settings file
